text:
Is there any different between `&` and `&&`? I have a function that needs to evaluate to true if a variable `t` is between two numbers.
```function npi_coverage_condition(u, t, integrator)
    t >= integrator.p.npi_start && t <= integrator.p.npi_end 
end```

elements.text: ? I have a function that needs to evaluate to true if a variable

text: Yes, a && b is equivalent to a ? b : a, and so that one doesn't require the evaluation of b if a is false. Also known as short circuiting

elements.text: Yes, a && b is equivalent to a ? b : a, and so that one doesn't require the evaluation of b if a is false. Also known as short circuiting

text:
btw you can do this:
```1 <= t <= 3```
to answer the original question, `&` is bitwise and, a quick  `?&` will tell you everything about it

elements.text: will tell you everything about it
